alert.note: Alert for Bristol Bay (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Blizzard Warning issued December 22 at 5:32PM AKST until December 23 at 3:00PM AKST by NWS Anchorage
info.description: ...BLIZZARD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 3 PM AKST SATURDAY FOR THE BRISTOL BAY COAST... * WHAT...Blizzard conditions. Additional snow accumulations of up to 9 inches. Winds gusting as high as 40 mph. * WHERE...Bristol Bay coast, including Port Heiden and from Dillingham west to Goodnews Bay. * WHEN...Until 3 PM AKST Saturday. * IMPACTS...Plan on difficult travel conditions. Areas of blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...The snow band is expected to span from the Alaska Peninsula, through Dillingham, and north along the Kuskokwim Mountains. Port Heiden will see the longest duration of blizzard conditions as winds maintain strength through Saturday afternoon. Easterly gusts as high as 45 mph are possible around Iliamna Lake tonight, but no snow or blowing snow is expected for this area.
info.instruction: A Blizzard Warning means severe winter weather conditions are expected or occurring. Falling and blowing snow with strong winds and poor visibilities are likely. This will lead to whiteout conditions, making travel very hazardous. If you must travel, have a winter survival kit with you.If you get stranded, stay with your vehicle.
